intro: Sarcophyton taiwanianum, commonly known as the Taiwan leather coral, is a species of stony coral found in tropical and subtropical marine environments. It belongs to the family Lobopodiidae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy polyps that are often covered in a layer of mucus. The coral has a robust skeletal structure composed primarily of calcium carbonate, which provides support and protection. It typically grows in shallow reef areas, forming colonies that contribute to reef biodiversity and structure. This species plays an important role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat for various marine organisms.
